name: Quaternion.Internal
comment:
Quaternions

Can express rotations, but not shearing, scaling or translations

Translations are trivial

Shearing and scaling don't happen in the real world

Scaling is trivial

So, a combination of translation and orientation (via quaternions)
is everything you need for world transforms.

Impossible transforms are inexpressible

Also, quaternions are faster than matrices due to 4 components not 9.


# API Design

This API is designed for efficiency: input ranges are documented, but
input values are not sanitized. For example, most rotation operations
require unit quaternions and unit axis vectors. Rather than normalizing
all inputs, which would add sqrt calls to all functions, the expected
values are documented.

# Angle-Axis representation

# Yaw-Pitch-Roll

# Conversions

# Co-ordinate systems

Rigid Body Dynamics, Inertial Reference Frames,
and Graphics Coordinate Systems:
A Resolution of Conflicting Conventions and Terminology
<http://citeseerx.ist.psu.edu/viewdoc/download?doi=10.1.1.58.99&rep=rep1&type=pdf>

Construction from angle, axis.
This will create a unit quaternion if given a unit vector.

values.comment: Construct a Quaternion from its representation as a scalar and a vector

values.name: getAngle
values.comment:
Angle of rotation.
Returns angle in radians, in the range [0, 2*pi)

values.name: getAxis
values.comment: Unit vector along the axis of rotation

values.name: getI
values.comment: Extract the i component of a quaternion.

values.name: getJ
values.comment: Extract the j component of a quaternion.

values.name: getK
values.comment: Extract the k component of a quaternion.

values.name: getScalar
values.comment: Extract the scalar component of a quaternion.

values.name: hamilton
values.comment: Hamilton product

values.name: length
values.comment: The length of the given quaternion: |a|

values.name: lengthSquared
values.comment: The square of the length of the given quaternion: |a| * |a|

values.name: multv
values.comment: Multiplication of a quaternion by a vector

values.name: nearVertical
values.comment: Is the quaternion near vertical, either up or down?

values.name: negate
values.comment: Quaternion negation: -a

values.name: normalize
values.comment: A unit quaternion with the same direction as the given quaternion: a / |a|

values.name: quaternion
values.comment: Creates a new 4-element quaternion with the given x, y, z, and w values.

values.name: rotateQ
values.comment: Rotate quaternion q1 by quaternion q2

values.name: rotateV
values.comment: Rotate a vector v by the unit quaternion q

values.name: scale
values.comment: Multiply the quaternion by a scalar: s * q

values.name: setI
values.comment: Update the i component of a quaternion, returning a new quaternion.

values.name: setJ
values.comment: Update the j component of a quaternion, returning a new quaternion.

values.name: setK
values.comment: Update the k component of a quaternion, returning a new quaternion.

values.name: setScalar
values.comment: Update the scalar component of a quaternion, returning a new quaternion.

values.name: sub
values.comment: Quaternion subtraction: a - b

values.comment: Convert to a Mat4
